intro: Lobelia laxiflora f. flava, commonly known as the yellow-flowered lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland or swampy habitats. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a reddish or purple tinge. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
